11.15.4. Special Use Permit Required: The uses listed above shall be subject to

11.16.
CONCRETE AND ASPHALT PLANTS
11.16.1. Where Permitted: Light Industrial District; Special Use Permit Required
11.16.2. Requirements: Shall meet the requirement of Section 11.4 or 11.5 as
applicable to the district in which the use is located.
11.16.3. Special Use Permit Required: The uses listed above shall be subject to
special use permit procedures and requirements as set forth in Section 6.3.
This shall also include those previously licensed and existing when one
enumerated use is being applied for in lieu of or supplementary to another
enumerated use requiring or for which a special use permit has been
previously issued.
11.17.
CEMETERIES - INDEPENDENT AND FAMILY CEMETERIES; RELIGIOUS
INSTITUTIONS WITH CEMETERY
11.17.1. Where Permitted: R-A, R-20, R-15, R-15MH, R-12, and R-MF; Special
Use Permit Required
11.17.2. Requirements: Shall meet the requirement of Section 11.4 as applicable
to the district in which the use is located.
11.17.3 Additional Requirements:
A. North Carolina Cemetery Act: All cemeteries shall meet the
requirements set forth by the North Carolina Cemetery Act, and if
applicable, shall obtain a license from the North Carolina Cemetery
Commission.
B. Minimum Lot Size: A minimum of three (3) contiguous acres shall be
required to establish a cemetery, columbarium or mausoleum not located
on the same tract of land as a church. A minimum of one acre shall be
required for free-standing cemeteries.
C. Setbacks: The minimum setback for structures, graves and burial plots
from any exterior property line shall to 100 feet.
D. Cemeteries as an Accessory Use to a Church. Cemeteries, including
a columbarium, located on the same property as a church shall be subject
to the following criteria:
11-17

November
13, 2023

NEW PAGE 298
i. The cemetery shall not encroach on any yard setbacks.
ii. The requirements of accessory uses shall apply.
E. Initial Citing or Expansion Request: The following conditions shall
apply:
1) Whenever it is proposed to establish a cemetery or to extend the
boundaries of an existing cemetery, the party that is proposing
shall make written application to the Planning Board for a Special
Use Permit, the requirements for which are outlined in Article 6.
2) All "Plots" are to be setback a minimum of twenty (20) feet from
the property line of the cemetery; and the new cemetery property
lines are to be a minimum of twenty (20) feet from the original
property line.
3) A twenty (20') foot easement ingress, egress, and regress granted
to person(s) shall be reasonable and limited to the purposes of
visiting graves, maintaining the gravesite or cemetery, or
conducting genealogy research. The right of ingress and egress
shall not be constructed to provide a right to operate motor
vehicles on the property for accessing a cemetery or gravesite
unless there is a road or adequate right-of-way that permits access
by motor vehicle and the owner has given written permission to
use the road or right-of way of necessity.
4) The Cemetery is to be continuously maintained by the church
organization, corporation or non-profit corporation.
5) A sign not to exceed 32 square feet (4'x8'), identifying the
Cemetery is to be erected at the entrance of the Cemetery a
minimum of seventy (70') feet from the center of a state-
maintained highway.
6) A Plat Map & Deed must be recorded before the Special Use Permit
can be recorded.
7) Only one (1) person may be in a burial space except for a parent
and infant or two (2) infants buried at the same time.
8) All plots/graves shall be located in an orderly and neat appearing
manner within the confines of the burial space involved.
11.17.4 Family Cemeteries.
A.
R-A District only as a Special Use
1) Must be surveyed and recorded with Mapping and Register of
Deeds.
2)
The Cemetery is to be continuously maintained by the heirs of
11-18

November
13, 2023

NEW PAGE 299
the family and everyone buried there is to be an heir.
3) Must be named.
4) Must have a minimum 10 ft. ingress and egress.
5) Must not exceed 100 ft. X 200 ft. area.
6) Gravesites must be at least 100 feet from any water supply.
7) Cemetery boundaries must be at least 100 feet from existing
dwelling.
8) A fence is to be erected around the perimeter of the cemetery or
once established (body placed).
9) All markers or memorials must be of durable compositions.
Markers may not be homemade.
10) Only one (1) person may be in a burial space.
11) Back-yard burials are not permitted; and it shall be unlawful to
bury a dead body outside of a registered cemetery in the Town of
Bladenboro.

1)

addition, the total number of children on the playground shall not
exceed the number the space will accommodate at seventy-five

licensed for thirty (30) or more children shall have seventy-five

land otherwise unsuitable for children's play space.

building, awnings, trees, or other methods.
